item.description:
Four (Thatâ€™s Right, Four!) Tall Ships are visiting Portsmouth. We will put in at Fort Stark on Newcastle Island at 7:30 am and paddle to the Coast Guard Station to view the Parade of Sails that is scheduled to begin at 8:00 am. The 300 foot US Coast Guard Eagle will lead the parade, followed by the 141 foot Kalmar Nyckel, then the 140 foot Spirit of South Carolina, and lastly, the 125 foot Spirit of Massachusetts.

This is a great way to view the Tall Ships and well worth taking the day off of work for. For more information about the Portsmouth Tall Ship visit, view the following link

Portsmouth Tall Ships Parade

This will be an Intermediate Level 2 ocean paddle, restricted to Sea Kayaks 14 feet or longer due to potential of ocean waves and currents.

Low Tide at Portsmouth Harbor is at 7:01 am, High Tide is at 1:17 pm

Launch Site options are listed below Click on Site for map and directions

Odiorne State Park Boat Launch Rt. 1A Rye NH.

Pierce Island Launch Site Portsmouth NH just past the pool

Fort Stark Launch Site at the end of Wild Rose Ln. NewCastle NH


Click on the picture above to view the location of where the Tall Ship Parade will start as well as the location near the Fort Constitution Coast Guard Station / Light House where we kayakers will be meeting and observing the ship parade.

Click the link below for a Google Map of the Fort Constitution and Portsmouth Harbor Light House on-water meeting location. You can re-size the map if you want to see the other launch locations at Fort Stark or Odiorne Rt.1A.

Google Maps map of Fort Constitution / Portsmouth Harbor Light house
item.name: Portsmouth Tall Ship Paddle
